node.title: Canceled practices point to more virus trouble in the N.B.A.
node.description: The Indiana Pacers and Toronto Raptors basketball teams abruptly canceled practices on Thursday, citing the N.B.A.’s Covid-19 health and safety protocols.

node.title: We Need Less Talk and More Action From Congress on Tech
node.description: Mosseri talks while Congress dithers.

node.title: Court of Appeals Block Trump's Executive Privilege Claim, Rule Biden Gets Final Say
node.description: Former President Donald Trump's attorneys have signaled they will appeal the ruling to the Supreme Court.

node.title: Killer of Massey police officer Matthew Hunt to be sentenced
node.description: The man who murdered policeman Matthew Hunt and tried to kill his partner is due to be sentenced this morning.

node.title: Your Friday Briefing: Boosters and Vaccine Equity
node.description: The W.H.O. says the rollout leaves poor nations behind.

node.title: John Hagins, Caught With Rifle, Wanted to 'Enact a Columbine' at Florida College: Police
node.description: Police in Florida said they arrested a 19-year-old for allegedly "plotting to shoot up the campus on the final day at the school before winter break."

node.title: New York City Business Owners Feeling Added Stress of COVID Vaccine Mandate for Employees
node.description: Employees of around 184,000 businesses in the city will have to be at least partially vaccinated by December 27.

node.title: Bannon, Gaetz Call for 'Shock Troops' to Take Control of Government if Trump Returns in '24
node.description: "Get them ready now," Bannon said, calling for some 4,000 Trump loyalists to be prepared to take over the federal government.

node.title: How I broke through the barriers to become a fashion icon of the Perth racing circuit
node.description: The fashion industry is worth $27.2 billion in Australia, but what do you do when the fashion industry wasn’t built for you?

node.title: Person taken to hospital after incident at Ports of Auckland
node.description: A person has been taken to hospital in a serious condition after an incident at Ports of Auckland.

node.title: Travis Scott gives first interview since Astroworld tragedy
node.description: "I didn't even know the exact detail until minutes before the press conference," Scott said.

node.title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
node.description: Britcoms, artisans and “Doom Patrol”: If you’ve got couch time, our critic has recommendations.

node.title: Is Self-Censorship a Problem for Writers?
node.description: At an event organized by PEN America, four prominent writers debated art, identity, appropriation and the state of free expression. (Fisticuffs not included.)

node.title: Kentucky Man Sold Young Daughter, Who Then Gave Birth to Buyer's Baby: Police
node.description: The girl had been living with the man since August 2020 after her 34-year-old father allegedly sold her to him.

node.title: Business-Friendly South Carolina Set to Debate Ban on Vaccine Mandates
node.description: The hastily drafted bill would ban private companies from firing those who refuse COVID-19 vaccines.

node.title: 'Absolutely False' Biden Pressured Ukraine to Cede Land to Russia to Avoid War: Psaki
node.description: Reports claimed the Biden administration wanted Ukraine to cede autonomy of eastern territory that's being controlled by Russia-backed separatists.

node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Paused, Expected to Resume Friday After Attorney Falls Ill
node.description: An attorney in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial became sick and needed medical care, but it's not related to COVID. The trial is put on hold until tomorrow.

node.title: Keith Smith, Who Blamed Panhandler for Wife's Stabbing Death, Convicted of Murder
node.description: Investigators were originally told that a male suspect had reached into the Smiths' vehicle and stabbed the victim to death after fighting over a wallet.

node.title: Independents Believe U.S. Is Heading in Wrong Direction Amid Biden's Low Approval Rating
node.description: Independent voters were crucial to President Joe Biden's election win in 2020 as they favored him over former president Donald Trump by 13 points.

node.title: CoronaCheck: Did Pfizer add an ingredient to its vaccine that was 'illegal' for kids under 16?
node.description: A viral social media post purporting to be from a critical care nurse claims Pfizer has added an ingredient that is 'illegal' for children under the age of 16 to its vaccine. But that's not correct.

node.title: Friday news quiz: Will you score a ton or find yourself out for a duck?
node.description: It's been a particularly sporty week in the news. Are you ready to test yourself? Ready, set … go!

node.title: Gladys Berejiklian rules out running for federal seat of Warringah
node.description: Former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian rules herself out of the running for the federal seat of Warringah.

node.title: Texas man held at gunpoint by federal agent seeks Supreme Court's help
node.description: "Are federal officials somehow different than state and local officials?" said Anya Bidwell, a lawyer with the Institute for Justice.

node.title: Planet ten times the size of Jupiter found orbiting pair of giant stars
node.description: Scientists once thought huge planets could not exist in a two-star system. Not anymore.

node.title: Jussie Smollett Timeline: A Case With Twists and Turns
node.description: The case began in 2019 when the actor reported that he had been the victim of a racist and homophobic attack, and led to a trial in which he was accused of staging the attack himself.

node.title: As Muratov Accepts Nobel, Legacy of His Russian Predecessors Recedes
node.description: Dmitri A. Muratov is only the third Russian to win the Nobel Peace Prize, after Andrei D. Sakharov and Mikhail S. Gorbachev. The openness they championed is under assault.

node.title: Trump Organization Calls AG's Deposition Request to Ex-Potus 'Another Political Witch-Hunt'
node.description: This report comes as New York State Attorney General Letitia James announced she intends to end her bid for governor and will focus on ongoing investigations.

node.title: Americans Break Record for Money Won in Single Year—$44 Billion, Gaming Industry Says
node.description: "The industry is in a strong position for a full recovery," said American Gaming Association President and CEO Bill Miller.

node.title: All of today's coronavirus news in the one spot
node.description: Get up to speed on all the coronavirus news from across Australia.

node.title: New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art removes Sackler family name
node.description: The Sacklers, major benefactors of the museum, made their fortune as owners of Purdue Pharma​, a drug company accused of fueling the opioid crisis.
